<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Returns a list of language extensions that can run within KQL queries.

Azure REST API version: 2021-06-01-preview.




## Using listKustoPoolLanguageExtensions {#using}

Two invocation forms are available. The direct form accepts plain
arguments and either blocks until the result value is available, or
returns a Promise-wrapped result. The output form accepts
Input-wrapped arguments and returns an Output-wrapped result.

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#languageextensionname_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">language<wbr>Extension<wbr>Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>The language extension name.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>
